questions.question: What is the primary benefit of using the Alamouti scheme in a BPSK system?

answers.c: Diversity gain and reduced bit error rate

explanations.a: The Alamouti scheme primarily improves reliability, not data rate.
explanations.b: Spectral efficiency is not significantly improved in this scheme.
explanations.c: Correct. The Alamouti scheme provides diversity gain and reduces the bit error rate.
explanations.d: It does not directly lower transmission power.

questions.question: How many time slots does the Alamouti scheme use to transmit two symbols in a BPSK system?

explanations.a: One time slot is not sufficient for transmitting two symbols in this scheme.
explanations.b: Correct. The Alamouti scheme transmits two symbols over two time slots.
explanations.c: Three time slots are not required.
explanations.d: Four time slots would be excessive for this scheme.

questions.question: In the Alamouti scheme, how many transmitter antennas are used?

explanations.a: One transmitter antenna does not provide spatial diversity.
explanations.b: Correct. The Alamouti scheme uses two transmitter antennas.
explanations.c: Three antennas are not used in the basic Alamouti scheme.
explanations.d: Four antennas are excessive for this scheme.

questions.question: What type of diversity is achieved by using the Alamouti scheme in a BPSK system?

explanations.a: The scheme does not rely on time diversity.
explanations.b: Frequency diversity is not the focus here.
explanations.c: Correct. The Alamouti scheme achieves spatial diversity using multiple antennas.
explanations.d: Polarization diversity is unrelated to the Alamouti scheme.

questions.question: Which channel model is most commonly used for testing the Alamouti scheme?

explanations.a: AWGN only does not represent realistic multipath fading.
explanations.b: Correct. Rayleigh fading is used to test systems with multipath propagation.
explanations.c: Rician fading is also used but less common than Rayleigh for Alamouti.
explanations.d: Free space model lacks fading effects needed for Alamouti tests.

questions.question: What assumption is made at the receiver for decoding the Alamouti scheme?

answers.a: The receiver has perfect channel state information (CSI).
answers.b: The transmitter and receiver are synchronized only in time.
answers.c: The receiver knows the exact noise power.
answers.d: The receiver estimates CSI with some error margin.

explanations.a: Correct. The receiver typically assumes perfect CSI for optimal decoding.
explanations.b: Synchronization is not the only assumption.
explanations.c: Noise power knowledge is not assumed.
explanations.d: Decoding assumes perfect CSI for ideal performance.

questions.question: How does the Alamouti scheme handle the received signal for decoding?

answers.a: It uses only the signal from one antenna.
answers.b: It combines signals from two antennas with conjugate multiplication.
answers.c: It averages the received signals over multiple time slots.
answers.d: It decodes the received signal without any processing.

explanations.a: Both antennas are used for spatial diversity.
explanations.b: Correct. The scheme combines signals using complex conjugate multiplication.
explanations.c: Averaging is not used in Alamouti decoding.
explanations.d: Processing is essential for accurate decoding.

questions.question: What is the key advantage of the Alamouti scheme in terms of complexity?

explanations.a: Transmission power is not significantly reduced.
explanations.b: Correct. The scheme allows for simple linear decoding at the receiver.
explanations.c: Channel estimation is needed for decoding.
explanations.d: Spectral efficiency is not the main advantage.

questions.question: Which property of the channel is crucial for the Alamouti scheme to work effectively?

answers.a: The channel must be stationary and flat fading during two time slots.
answers.b: The channel must change rapidly to achieve better diversity.
answers.c: The channel must have Rician fading characteristics.
answers.d: The channel must have no noise.

explanations.a: Correct. The channel should be constant during the two time slots for proper decoding.
explanations.b: Rapid changes disrupt the decoding process.
explanations.c: Rician fading is not necessary for the scheme.
explanations.d: Noise is always present and accounted for in the design.
